opportunityTitle: Cooperative Ecosystem Studies Unit, Pacific Northwest CESU

fundingActivityCategories.description: Science and Technology and other Research and Development

cfdas.programTitle: U.S. Geological Survey Research and Data Collection

applicantTypes.description: Others (see text field entitled "Additional Information on Eligibility" for clarification)

applicantEligibilityDesc:
This financial assistance opportunity is being issued under a 
Cooperative Ecosystem Studies Unit (CESU) Program.  CESU¿s are 
partnerships that provide research, technical assistance, and 
education.  Eligible recipients must be a participating partner of the 
Pacific Northwest Cooperative Ecosystems Unit (CESU) Program.
synopsisDesc: US Geological Survey, Columbia Environmental Research Center, is offering a funding opportunity to a CESU Partner to provide expertise in application of lead (Pb) isotopic analyses to establish baseline moss tissue and snowpack elemental isotopic ratios at Bering Land Bridge National Preserve in northwestern Alaska to enable source attribution, and to provide data that will assist with validation of coastal and interior moss tissue concentration-atmospheric deposition models for use in critical loads/early warning signs ecological monitoring.
